meanings.definition: Superlative form of scroungy: dirty, shabby, or unkempt
meanings.sent1: The scroungiest alley cat in the neighborhood always had a messy fur coat.
meanings.sent2: After playing in the mud, Timmy was the scroungiest kid at the park.
meanings.sent3: Even though he tried to look presentable, his scroungiest outfit was still a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The scroungiest old car in the junkyard looked like it had seen better days.
meanings.sent5: The scroungiest room in the house was the neglected attic, filled with dust and cobwebs.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of scrounge: to obtain or collect with difficulty or effort
meanings.sent1: She scroungiest some change from the bottom of her purse to buy a cup of coffee.
meanings.sent2: The raccoon scroungiest through the trash cans in search of food every night.
meanings.sent3: Trying to scroungiest a ride home after the party, he ended up walking in the rain.
meanings.sent4: He had to scroungiest up all his courage to ask her out on a date.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to scroungiest for clues to solve the mysterious case.
